urls.title: What to do in a flood - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
Flooding can happen at any time.

With 5.2 million homes and businesses at risk of flooding, it’s important to be aware of the small steps you can take now to be better prepared.

Know what to do in a flood 👉 https://t.co/yDrqZN037T https://t.co/XD1erHEm93

What’s the collective term for 5 surface velocity radar gauges?! These are installed at Stoodleigh Gauging Station on the River Exe to improve @EnvAgencySW flow data- helping us reduce flood risk downstream. Perhaps the last project of 20-21! https://t.co/ndPlZnfEu3

urls.title: Welsh Harp Reservoir

tweets.text: The scale of the environmental crisis facing Brent Reservoir (Welsh Harp) is illustrated in the photos I have taken this year. Here's a photo album on @Flickr that tells the story. Stakeholders must now act to save this famous #SSSI → https://t.co/lh0HxOyIqq https://t.co/kwDHJGGIJG

tweets.text:
Phase1 @WildTroutTrust & Kilnsey AC. White Beck #Wharfe protected from livestock so riparian flora can develop + tree planting (thanks @kilnseypark @TCVtweets #IDigTrees).
Phase2 in-channel spawning & fry habitat funded by @EnvAgencyYNE #FIP & WTT's @YorkshireWater TROUT project https://t.co/uwDSw57FWH

@DaveDav58119150 @CamillaHorrox @jenstridonkai @darrenmoore @WorldBollard @SpacePootler @mariamartak @SchJustina11 @ellielockx @P_DriscollW5W13 @MetCC @EnvAgency @XREaling @RBourchier @standardnews Not sure how an LTN in London is going to affect the pro cycling scene, but if you insist...

urls.title: AI reveals 1,000 'dark discharges' of untreated sewage in England
urls.description: Paper says machine learning could prove crucial tool in efforts to improve quality of country’s rivers

tweets.text:
Sewage discharges still being discussed in the press, it shows the magnitude of the problem. Only public opinion will get politicians to listen, @EnvAgency hide it away, creating protocols that allow 50 days of discharge to be counted as 1 incident.

https://t.co/ry6RE0vGMW

I realise that Twitter is not representative but is anyone satisfied with @EnvAgency performance in any of the areas they cover? I only see complaints (rivers, waste, flooding) and yet they have no oversight or real accountability.

tweets.text: @CamillaHorrox @saddleblaze @jenstridonkai @darrenmoore @WorldBollard @SpacePootler @mariamartak @SchJustina11 @ellielockx @P_DriscollW5W13 @MetCC @EnvAgency @XREaling @RBourchier @standardnews Hi Camilla is also worth contacting some others from Ealing that aren't Cycling journalists with vested interests in Ltn schemes.

tweets.text: @IanSnakeGeek @SaveLeaMarshes @deedeelea @HMUG_Hackney @thameswater @EnvAgency Yeah will do. I will DM you as I a under strick instructions to keep numbers doing maintenance to under 6. But need to get on with it before trees grow. Spk soon

We need to apply to the @EnvAgency just to overturn a bloody rock in our local stream, it’s got rare white clawed crayfish, but a farmer can do what he likes in a mini digger. Safe in the knowledge nothing will happen to him @Feargal_Sharkey @TonyJuniper @CraigBennett3 #ecocide https://t.co/aGQaFF0G0M

Construction on the Otley Flood Alleviation Scheme began this week. Read the latest update here: https://t.co/G83uvgxSVp 

@EnvAgencyYNE @BAMNuttall @MottMacDonald

tweets.text: @DobbyWoods @Walthamsteve @IanSnakeGeek @SaveLeaMarshes @deedeelea @HMUG_Hackney @thameswater @EnvAgency I assume you don't mean geese? 🙂

@ProfJGrey @WildTroutTrust @kilnseypark @TCVtweets @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater @YorkDalesRT @Jack_Hirst3 @SandTCUKYorks @PeteTurnerEA @wildlifetoursuk Every river in the U.K. should be doing this work 👍

@DobbyWoods @SaveLeaMarshes @deedeelea @HMUG_Hackney @thameswater @EnvAgency Please let me know when you’re doing this I’d like to, if it’s ok with you, get some footage. I want to make a film about the state of the river and how its left to just a handful of locals to try to clean up this filth.

@IanSnakeGeek @SaveLeaMarshes @deedeelea @HMUG_Hackney I am borrowing a couple  canadians in next few weeks to have a go at cleaning the upper section up a bit. Weir to Red Bridge. Will have a go lower down if that is successful. The wet wipes and sanitary waste is what disgusts me the most. Do @thameswater @EnvAgency care?

tweets.text: @Jogwiththedog @IanSnakeGeek @ECOWARRIORSS @deedeelea @HMUG_Hackney @CRTSouthEast are not responsible for the sewage overspills - this is @thameswater. The @EnvAgencySE know that TW are spilling raw sewage further upstream from here but there has never been any attempt to stop them. It's a dire situation.

@ben_watt @Flickr @CanalRiverTrust @NaturalEngland @BarnetCouncil @Brent_Council @EnvAgency @welshharpies @silkstreamers @Thames21 @RSPBEngland @GoodLawProject So grim. Can I help when you next do a litter pick?

tweets.text: @ProfJGrey @YorkDalesRT @daleslandnet @WoodlandTrust @h_r_marshall @theriverstrust @EnvAgencyYNE @Addingham_Group @yorkshire_dales @YorksWildlife @NEYorksNLincs How did you manage that? 🤣 Were you cloud watching?

urls.title: Nature gets £1.8million to help it blossom | The Wildlife Trust for Lancashire, Manchester and North Merseyside
urls.description: Nature is on the road to recovery in Greater Manchester pollinated by £1.8million from the Green Recovery Challenge Fund.

tweets.text:
In Dec 20, #GM secured 1.8 million from the #GreenRecoveryChallengeFund. @NorthernRootsOL is one of a programme of priority projects to receive funding from @DefraGovUK, delivered by @HeritageFundUK in partnership @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency. 

https://t.co/zgpcRemRxP https://t.co/WlJJUbZkO3

@Jack_Hirst3 @WildTroutTrust @kilnseypark @TCVtweets @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater @YorkDalesRT @SandTCUKYorks @PeteTurnerEA @wildlifetoursuk Yes, will be good to kickstart #geomorphology again after past shackling and channelisation. Get some flow diversity and sediment sorting in play

tweets.text: @ProfJGrey @WildTroutTrust @kilnseypark @TCVtweets @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater @YorkDalesRT @SandTCUKYorks @PeteTurnerEA @wildlifetoursuk This looks great! Be interesting to see how the channel bed changes! Especially when you can get in with the flow deflectors!

@Jack_Hirst3 @YorkDalesRT @daleslandnet @WoodlandTrust @h_r_marshall @theriverstrust @EnvAgencyYNE @Addingham_Group @yorkshire_dales @YorksWildlife @NEYorksNLincs Hailstones up the nostrils was a new one on me today

@ProfJGrey @YorkDalesRT @daleslandnet @WoodlandTrust @h_r_marshall @theriverstrust @EnvAgencyYNE @Addingham_Group @yorkshire_dales @YorksWildlife @NEYorksNLincs The main issue today was trying to find away around them! Also, lockdown hair and heavy rain meant for a rather obscured view today!

urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: ⚠️ There is one flood warning in place at Porlock Weir. Beware of potential overtopping early tomorrow morning https://t.co/fu6u4honYV https://t.co/4Q4m7AH89z
Users update - #Culham lock is closed due to hydraulic hose burst under the River bed - we will keep users updated . @EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @Jennifer_Hil1 @TW11Harbour

Good but soggy site visit to #Bishopdale with @daleslandnet today. Really good to see the scrapes we installed 18 months ago working well, absorbing overland flow! Also the #trees planted this year looked well, thank you @WoodlandTrust & @h_r_marshall for providing them! #nfm https://t.co/CijbkcS3db

A major milestone is reached in a £4.8m Middlesbrough flood scheme as a new debris screen is installed. 

The Marton West Beck flood scheme will better protect nearly 500 homes in the town, and also includes new flood walls and drainage system.

Read more: https://t.co/BmpfFTCMRr https://t.co/GcAWc4MFkn
@sussex_ifca @BlueRobotics @Carcinus_Ltd @EnvAgency Deep Blue ROV! https://t.co/FAH1Y98pyq
@PaulReevesEA @EnvAgencyMids Will do👍
